section.title: Listing Domains in Configuration
section.para: In this example, the rhevm-manage-domains command is used to list the domains defined in the Red Hat Enterprise Virtualization Manager configuration. For each configuration entry the command displays the domain, the user name — in User Principle Name (UPN) format — and whether the domain is local or remote.

example.title: rhevm-manage-domains List Action
example.screen: # rhevm-manage-domains -action=list Domain: directory.demo.redhat.com User name: admin@DIRECTORY.DEMO.REDHAT.COM This domain is a remote domain.
